description: 10th Edition Weapon Modifications (6 types, roll TWO different)

weaponModifications.name: Finely Balanced
weaponModifications.effect: Improve the Ballistic Skill or Weapon Skill characteristic of this weapon by 1 (e.g., a BS of 3+ would become 2+).

weaponModifications.name: Brutal
weaponModifications.effect: Add 1 to the Strength characteristic of this weapon.

weaponModifications.name: Armour Piercing
weaponModifications.effect: Improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of this weapon by 1 (e.g., an AP of -1 would become -2).

weaponModifications.name: Master-Worked
weaponModifications.effect: Add 1 to the Damage characteristic of this weapon.

weaponModifications.name: Heirloom
weaponModifications.effect: Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this weapon.

weaponModifications.name: Precise
weaponModifications.effect: Each time a Critical Wound is scored with this weapon, the attack gains the [PRECISION] ability.

rules: When a unit gains a Weapon Enhancement Battle Honour, select ONE weapon
Roll 2D6 for TWO different weapon modifications
If you roll the same result twice, re-roll until you get two different results
Apply BOTH modifications to the selected weapon
Must select CHARACTER model's weapon if unit is CHARACTER
Must select Unit Champion's weapon if unit has one and is not CHARACTER
Cannot modify weapons that are Enhancements or Crusade Relics
Cannot modify a weapon that already has weapon modifications
Weapon modifications are lost if the weapon is replaced via Enhancements or Rearm and Resupply
notes: Weapon Modifications count as ONE Battle Honour
Contributes +1 CP (or +2 if TITANIC) like any other honour
Two modifications per weapon is mandatory, not optional
